metadata.Title: CVE-2023-38428 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.3.4.fs/ksmbd/smb2pdu.c in ksmbd does not properly check the UserName valuebecause it does not consider the address of security buffer, leading to anout-of-bounds read.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38428` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-32-generic - 6.2.0-32.32
linux-image-6.2.0-32-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-32.32
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-32-generic - 6.2.0-32.32
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-32-generic-64k - 6.2.0-32.32
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1012-kvm - 6.2.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-aws - 6.2.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-azure - 6.2.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1013-gcp - 6.2.0-1013.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1009-ibm - 6.2.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1012-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1012.12
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1012-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-oracle - 6.2.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1012-raspi - 6.2.0-1012.14
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-starfive - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-32.32').
linux-kvm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1012.12').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1011.11').
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1011.11').
linux-gcp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1013.13').
linux-ibm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1009.9').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1012.12').
linux-oracle package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1011.11').
linux-raspi package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1012.14').
linux-starfive package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1004.5').
